subject: Re: FW: Threat Intel Notification – New Balada Injector campaign infects 6,700 WordPress sites – Action Required
preview: Hi Sahil, Most welcome. That is correct, the plugin does not feature on any of the Aviso group of sites.

full_threads.body:
Hi Sahil, 

Most welcome. That is correct, the plugin does not feature on any of the Aviso group of sites.

Thanks Chris.

Please have you confirm that this is not used by any off the other sites that are part of the Envest group - avisobroking.com.au, etc.

Thanks,
Sahil

Thanks Nichole - appreciate the info below from Chris.

Earlier I have sent another separate email to WolfIQ as well, so I will continue to use that to follow up/confirm on additional items.

Eric Chong
Security Operations Analyst

Hi Nichole, 

Thanks for sharing. 

Our development team has reviewed the bulletin and is happy to report the plugin does not feature on the Envest website. 

There are no further steps required at this stage. Please let me know if require any further information.

action.text: Manuel Lito Manceli assigned to Chris Paradowski

full_threads.body: @chris so far, they don't need to worry about it...  as long as we did not install the plugin Popup Builder plugin to their website it's still safe and also we continue monitoring.
hi @manuel, can you please review and let me know once the appropriate steps have been taken? I will send update to the client.

From: Sahil Tulsiani <Sahil@envest.com.au>
Date: Wednesday, 17 January 2024 at 6:53 am
To: Eric Chong <eric.chong@envest.com.au>, Josh Hall <josh.hall@envest.com.au>
Cc: Nichole Valk <nichole@envest.com.au>, Megan Houston <megan@envest.com.au>
Subject: Fwd: Threat Intel Notification - New Balada Injector campaign infects 6,700 WordPress sites - Action Required

Morning,

Let's reach out to WolfIQ to make sure we implement the mitigation steps below.

Thanks,
Sahil.

From: Patrick Abdul-Ahad <Patrick.Abdul-Ahad@ardonagh.com>
Sent: Tuesday, January 16, 2024 10:59:25 PM
Cc: Patrick Abdul-Ahad <Patrick.Abdul-Ahad@ardonagh.com>
Subject: Threat Intel Notification - New Balada Injector campaign infects 6,700 WordPress sites - Action Required


You don't often get email from patrick.abdul-ahad@ardonagh.com. Learn why this is important

Hello Everyone,

 

We urge you to read the following information and ask that your local IT teams inform us whether they believe they are exposed to this vulnerability (and if so, what measures will be taken to mitigate) by COB tomorrow.

A little over 6,700 WordPress websites using a vulnerable version of the Popup Builder plugin have been infected with the Balada Injector malware in a campaign that launched in mid-December.

Balada Injector is a massive operation running since 2017 that had compromised more than 17,000 WordPress sites. The attacks inject a backdoor that redirects visitors of compromised sites to fake support pages, lottery sites, and push notification scams.The latest campaign launched on December 13, 2023, two days after WPScan reported about CVE-2023-6000, a cross-site scripting (XSS) flaw in Popup Builder versions 4.2.3 and older. Popup Builder is being used on 200,000 sites to build custom popups for marketing, informational, and functional purposes.

Exploitation Walkthrough

  • Balada Injector was quick to incorporate an exploit for the flaw, which hijacked the "sgpbWillOpen" event in Popup Builder and executed malicious JavaScript code in the site's database when the popup launched.
  • The attackers also used a secondary infection method by modifying the wp-blog-header.php file to inject the same JavaScript backdoor.
  • Next, the threat actor checked for admin-related cookies that allowed them to load various script sets to inject the main backdoor, disguised as a plugin named 'wp-felody.php.'
  • The researchers report that the infection never stops at the first step, and planting the main backdoor always follows the initial breach.
  • The functionality of the 'felody' backdoor includes arbitrary PHP code execution, uploading and executing files, communication with the attackers, and fetching additional payloads.

Mitigation Steps

  • Do not use the plugin "Popup Builder" if you do not currently use it. If you have it installed, please remove it and use an alternative more reliable plugin. Please inform us if that is the case so we can advise further.
  • Make sure all your website software, including web server hosts, plugins & themes on all your different WordPress sites are regularly updated to the latest versions. Automatic updates is an option if you have many sites to manage.
  • Conducting regular cleans of software by removing plugins, themes etc. that are no longer being used.
  • Activate Multi-Factor Authentication on your WordPress sites and use a strong unique complex password. Do not share login details with anyone.
  • Limiting number of site administrators and their permissions. Creating privileged accounts should generate alerts to appropriate teams.
  • Keeping local development environment files separate from server files.
  • Implementing file integrity control systems in case of compromise and changing database passwords after compromise.
  • Conduct internal and routine penetration testing or similar assessments against web applications to identify exploitable weaknesses before Balada does.
  • Heavily restrict access to sensitive files like wp-config, website backup data, log files or database archives and ensure strong data retention policies purge older versions of this data when no longer needed.
  • Disable unnecessary or insecure server services and protocols like FTP.

External Links

  • https://cybernews.com/security/wordpress-malware-epidemic-balada-injector/
  • https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/new-balada-injector-campaign-infects-6-700-wordpress-sites/
  • https://thehackernews.com/2024/01/balada-injector-infects-over-7100.html
  • https://securityaffairs.com/157470/malware/balada-injector-malware-wordpress-sites.html
  • https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/massive-balada-injector-campaign-attacking-wordpress-sites-since-2017/
  • https://www.techradar.com/pro/one-of-the-most-worrying-wordpress-malware-threats-is-making-a-comeback
  • https://www.makeuseof.com/balada-injector-infecting-wordpress-sites/

Warm regards,

Find out more

Patrick Abdul-Ahad

Cyber Security Analyst

THE ARDONAGH GROUP
